parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF
parameter.description: Flush PWM thermostat module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system.

options.option: ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

parameter.name: config_11_2
parameter.label: 11: I1 Functionality Selection
parameter.description: Default Value = 1. 65535 – Input I1 does not influence on the heat/cool process. 1 - Input I1 changes the mode of the thermostat between OFF and AUTO. In this case function on flood sensor (if connected) is disabled. 2 - input I1 influences on cooling and heating valves according to status of flood sensor. In this case function of OFF and AUTO selection by I1 is disabled.

parameter.name: config_12_2
parameter.label: 12: I2 Functionality Selection
parameter.description: Default = 65535, 65535 - I2 does not influence on the heat/cool process, From From 0 to 990 - Temperature set point from 0.0 C to 99.0 C. When I2 is pressed, the temperature set point is automatically set to value defined here. In this case function of condense sensor is disabled. From 1001 to 1150 - Temperature set point from -0.1 C to -15.0 C. When I2 is pressed, temperature set point is automatically set to value defined here. In this case function of condense sensor is disabled. 2000 - I2 influences on the cooling valve according to status of condense sensor. In this case function of set point selection with I2 is disabled.

parameter.name: config_13_2
parameter.label: 13: I3 Functionality Selection
parameter.description: Default Value = 65535. 65535 – Input I3 does not influence on the heat/cool process. 1 - Input I3 changes the mode of the thermostat between OFF and AUTO. In this case function on window sensor is disabled. 2 - input I3 influences on cooling and heating valves according to status of window sensor. In this case function of HEAT and COOL selection by I3 is disabled.

parameter.name: config_40_1
parameter.label: 40: Power reporting in Watts on power change
parameter.description: Default Value = 0. 0 – Reporting Disabled 1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is sent (pushed) only when actual power in Watts in real time changes for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. NOTE: If power changed is less than 1W, the report is not sent (pushed) independent of percentage set.

parameter.name: config_42_2
parameter.label: 42: Power reporting in Watts by timer interval
parameter.description: Default Value = 300. 0 – Reporting Disabled 1 - 32767 = 1 second - 32767 seconds Reporting enabled. Power report is sent with time interval set by entered value.

parameter.name: config_45_1
parameter.label: 45: Antifreeze
parameter.description: Set value at which temperature the device will be turned on even if the termpearture was manually set to off. Parameter can be set from 0 to 255 where 0 to 127 means from 0.0 C to 12.7 C and from 128 to 254 means from -0.1 C to -12.6 C Default = 0. 255 = Disabled NOTE:Antifreeze is activated only in heating mode.

parameter.name: config_50_1
parameter.label: 50: PWM Maximum Value
parameter.description: 2 - 100 = 2% - 100%, step is 1% Max PWM set by entered value. Default = 100. The Maximum level may not be lower than the minimum level.

parameter.name: config_51_1
parameter.label: 51: PWM Minimum Value
parameter.description: 1 - 99 = 1% - 99%, step is 1% Minimum PWM set by entered value. Default = 0. The Minimum level may exceed the maximum level.

parameter.name: config_52_1
parameter.label: 52: PWM Cycle Duration
parameter.description: 1 - 127 = 1-127 seconds, step is 1s PWM Cycle Duration set by entered value. Default = 10. NOTE:PWM Cycle duration defines the summary of all ON plus OFF time periods. For example if Output is set to 70% with PWM cycle duration of 20s, output will be on for 14s then OFF 6s, again 14s ON, etc..

parameter.name: config_53_1
parameter.label: 53: PID Value Inside Deadband
parameter.description: When value is set to ZERO PID inside deadband is forced to zero. LAST VALUE means PID remains on same level as was before entering into deadband.

options.option: PID value set to LAST VALUE

parameter.name: config_54_1
parameter.label: 54: PID Deadband
parameter.description: 0 - 127 = 0.0C - 12.7C step is 0.1 C This parameter defines the zone where PID is not active. If the temperature difference between actual and setpoint is bigger than PID deadband, then the PID will start to regulate the system, otherwise the PID is zero or fixed.

parameter.name: config_55_1
parameter.label: 55: Integral Sampling Time
parameter.description: 0 - 127 = 0s -127s step is 1s Parameter defines the time between samples. On each sample the controller captures difference between SP-act.

parameter.name: config_56_2
parameter.label: 56: P Parameter
parameter.description: 0 - 1000 P value step is 1. Default = 100

parameter.name: config_57_2
parameter.label: 57: I Parameter
parameter.description: 0 - 1000 - 0s I value step is 1. Default = 1

parameter.name: config_58_2
parameter.label: 58: D Parameter
parameter.description: 0 - 1000 - 0s D value step is 1. Default = 1

parameter.name: config_59_1
parameter.label: 59: Thermostat Mode
parameter.description: ***Add description here***

parameter.name: config_60_2
parameter.label: 60: Too low temperature limit
parameter.description: 1 - 1000 = 0.1 C - 100.0 C step is 0.1 C Too low temperature limit is set by entered value. In case measured temperature is below set value, module sends BasicSet value. Default = 50

parameter.name: config_61_2
parameter.label: 61: Too high temperature limit
parameter.description: 1 - 1000 = 0.1 C - 100.0 C step is 0.1 C Too high temperature limit is set by entered value. In case measured temperature is higher than set value, module sends BasicSet value. Default = 700

parameter.name: config_63_1
parameter.label: 63: Output Switch Selection
parameter.description: ***Add description here***

options.option: When system is turned off the output is 0V (NC)
When system is turned off the output is 230V (NO)

parameter.name: config_70_2
parameter.label: 70: Input 1 Status on delay
parameter.description: 1 - 32000 seconds. If the value of the parameter is different to 0, means that the influence of this input to heating or cooling will react after inserted time. Parameter 11 must be set to 2!

parameter.name: config_71_2
parameter.label: 71: Input 1 Status off delay
parameter.description: 1 - 32000 seconds. If the value of the parameter is different to 0, means that the influence of this input to heating or cooling will react after inserted time. Parameter 11 must be set to 2!

parameter.name: config_72_2
parameter.label: 72: Input 2 Status on delay
parameter.description: 1 - 32000 seconds. If the value of the parameter is different to 0, means that the influence of this input to heating or cooling will react after inserted time. Parameter 12 must be set to 2000!

parameter.name: config_73_2
parameter.label: 73: Input 2 Status off delay
parameter.description: 1 - 32000 seconds. If the value of the parameter is different to 0, means that the influence of this input to heating or cooling will react after inserted time. Parameter 12 must be set to 2000!

parameter.name: config_74_2
parameter.label: 74: Input 3 Status on delay
parameter.description: 1 - 32000 seconds. If the value of the parameter is different to 0, means that the influence of this input to heating or cooling will react after inserted time. Parameter 13 must be set to 2!

parameter.name: config_75_2
parameter.label: 75: Input 3 Status off delay
parameter.description: 1 - 32000 seconds. If the value of the parameter is different to 0, means that the influence of this input to heating or cooling will react after inserted time. Parameter 13 must be set to 2!

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: On/Off Triggered by Q State
parameter.description: basic on/off (triggered at change of the output Q state and reflecting its state)up to 16 nodes.

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: On/Off Triggered by I2
parameter.description: basic on/off (triggered at change of the input I2 state and reflecting its state)up to 16 nodes.

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: On/Off Triggered by I3
parameter.description: basic on/off (triggered at change of the input I3 state and reflecting its state)up to 16 nodes.

parameter.name: group_4
parameter.label: On/Off Triggerd by High Temp
parameter.description: basic on/off (triggered by Too high temperature limit, it sends FF ) to up to 16 nodes.

parameter.name: group_5
parameter.label: On/Off Trigger by Low Temp
parameter.description: basic on/off (triggered by Too low temperature limit, it sends FF ) to up to 16 nodes.

parameter.name: group_6
parameter.label: Controller Updates
parameter.description: ***Add description here***

parameter.name: wakeup_interval
parameter.label: Wakeup Period
parameter.description: Set the wakeup period in seconds

parameter.name: wakeup_node
parameter.label: Wakeup Node
parameter.description: The node to which wakeup messages will be sent
